website_summaries.verdict: The M.Zuiko 300mm f4 IS Pro is an excellent pro supertelephoto lens for the Micro Four Thirds mount.
pros: The M.Zuiko 300mm f4 IS Pro is sharp, fast to focus and has excellent image stabilization when used with an Olympus IS-Sync compatible camera
cons: It lacks a few important features

customer_reviews.title: 300 mm constant aperture lens
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lens by Olympus. Extremely sharp lens with excellent image stabilization which synchronizes with the in body stabilization of the Olympus Omd_Em1_MkII to enable hand held performance under sub optimal lighting . Built like a tank and dust , shock, water proof. The integrated lens hood is a genius addition. Love this lens
customer_reviews.author: Olympus

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp; small for this focal length.
customer_reviews.text: Just a terrific lens. I rented before buying from lensrental.com. I also tried renting the Panasonic 100-400mm zoom. To my hands they were similar in use and weight but Olympus seemed noticeably sharper. I use it with the lens stabilization turned on all the time as my interest is mostly trying to image birds. Certainly costly, but it should last: build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: jmclean

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sharp and all around excellent lens. I have the teleconverter and so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly sharp and all around excellent lens. I have the teleconverter and so far even on an EM5 it handles well and I'm getting great results. I know people get upset by comparing this to a 600 f/4, but I've found the DOF wide open on this lens to be so narrow I often need to stop down, and I can't imagine wanting it to be even more narrow. It's small enough that I can pack it in my bag and run errands or go to work and take pictures walking through the park on my way home. Fun lens to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good for bird pics and moon pics, yet heavy
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens for bird photography mostly. I also got this picture of the moon, hand held. Has great image stabilization. My pics are with this lens and Olympus om-d E-M10. The only con, is that it is a very heavy lens.
customer_reviews.author: Just the facts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality and reach...can’t wait for the 2X converter for wildlife shots:)
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Torres

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied this lens
customer_reviews.text: I use it with GH4 for the horse show, it is very sharp and auto focus mostly quickly picked up. Very satisfied this lens.
customer_reviews.author: ny

customer_reviews.title: Just received my lens today and I'm very pleased. My initial images all made handheld are very ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received my lens today and I'm very pleased. My initial images all made handheld are very sharp and look great. Wonderful fit and finish on this lens and feels very solid. Looking forward to using it a a trip I'm taking to Yellowstone in a week.
customer_reviews.author: BobinBoise

customer_reviews.title: Just Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the quality of the shots and the portability of the lens is just fantastic. I am ordering a 2nd one for my wife
customer_reviews.author: Alman

customer_reviews.title: Therefore its theoretical resolution is nearly the same when shooting objects like the moon
customer_reviews.text: The only lens I can personally compare this to for optical performance is the legendary Questar 3-1/5" telescope. The 300mm Olympus lens has a 3" aperture, nearly the same as the Questar. Therefore its theoretical resolution is nearly the same when shooting objects like the moon, and once the images are magnified to be similar size on a monitor or printer, the results in practice are quite close, with perhaps more contrast in the Olympus 300mm. Note the solar flare in the eclipse photo taken with the 300mm. When used for ordinary things like wildlife, it can give amazing results even handheld as can be seen with the prairie dog (cropped) about 35-30 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: 14carbonman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens, lives up to everything you will read about it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After numerous tests in all lighting conditions this lens is exemplary!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is just amazing. The image stabilization is far better than the Olympus 70-200 f2.8 PRO, and the images are much sharper, even wide open. I've used this for wildlife, of course, but also for a dance recital, all with great results. On the downside, the lens is quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: SmartBean

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my kit.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the lens -- it works as advertised (see photos). Unfortunately it highlights the weak link in the system: the resolution of the sensor. Nonetheless, the whole rig weighs a fraction of my full frame Nikon w/ 300mm f/2.8 setup with 2x expander.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: An amazing lens that I take most of my photo's with ...
customer_reviews.text: An amazing lens that I take most of my photo's with since birds and wildlife are what I enjoy photographing. Amazon prime gave me the ability to get this lens for a small premium in two days instead of waiting months on a back order list.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: you can get some nice videos. a bit heavy but if your shoulders ...
customer_reviews.text: very sharp lens, remarkable image stabilization, when used with the IBIS, you can get some nice videos. a bit heavy but if your shoulders are OK you will enjoy walking around with it, maybe you should consider having a light weight monopod.
customer_reviews.author: D. alhashimi

customer_reviews.title: Produces images with cornea-scratching sharpness
customer_reviews.text: What a difference a pro lens makes. Never thought my Olympus system would be capable of producing such details. Even with a 1.4x teleconverter, this lens is incredibly sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Small, Powerful, Sharp, Precise, Fast
customer_reviews.text: I had the pleasure of shooting with this lens over the weekend at a photography event. I was shooting sports and wildlife. The autofocus was extremely fast, images were razor sharp, and my arms weren't tired at the end of the day I am looking forward to having this lens full-time in the future for other sports and wildlife events.
customer_reviews.author: D Clark

product_meta.title: Olympus M.Zuiko Digital ED 300mm F4.0 PRO Lens, for Micro Four Thirds Cameras
product_meta.description: Style:BaseWorld's most compact, lightweight 300mm (600mm equivalent) f4.0 super telephoto lens makes super-telephoto hand-held photography possible.
feature_bullets: World's most powerful 6 steps of compensation synchronized in lens and in body Image Stabilization
Closest focus of 1.4 meters gives a 0.48X (35mm equivalent) telemacro photography, Focal Length : 300mm
Splash, Dust, and Freeze proof design
Manual focus clutch & Lfn button to instantly switch shooting styles
Compatible with the MC 14 tele converter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars33 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
